Luego, me senté en un banco de piedra que había en la callejuela, y me puse a contemplar el jardín desde abajo. La luz del sol se reflejaba en las hojas de los árboles, creando un efecto de luces y sombras que me pareció muy hermoso. Me quedé allí sentado durante un rato, disfrutando del silencio y la tranquilidad del lugar. De repente, escuché el sonido de pasos detrás de mí, y me di la vuelta para ver quién era. Era una mujer joven, con un vestido blanco y un sombrero de paja en la cabeza, que se acercaba hacia mí con una sonrisa en el rostro. Me pareció que conocía a esa mujer, pero no podía recordar de dónde la había visto antes. Me levanté del banco y me acerqué a ella, preguntándole si podía ayudarme en algo. Ella me miró con curiosidad y me dijo que se llamaba Sofía, y que había venido a visitar el jardín porque había oído hablar de su belleza. Le pregunté si sabía algo sobre el jardín, y ella me dijo que había oído que era un lugar mágico, donde las flores se abrían de noche y los árboles cantaban canciones. Me pareció una historia extraña, pero me gustó la idea de que el jardín fuera un lugar especial. Le pregunté a Sofía si quería acompañarme a explorar el jardín, y ella aceptó con entusiasmo. Juntos, nos adentramos en el jardín, y comenzamos a descubrir sus secretos y maravillas.

en_second_half: I jumped in before he could object. ‘The Church of St. Monica,’ said I, ‘and half a sovereign if you reach it in twenty minutes.’ It was twenty-five minutes to twelve, and of course it was clear enough what was in the wind.

I quickly jumped in, and we sped off before the woman could even notice. As we drove away, I caught a glimpse of her face in the rearview mirror, and I could have sworn I saw a flicker of recognition in her eyes. I turned to the driver and asked him where he was headed, and he told me he was going to the city square. I paid him the fare and stepped out onto the cobblestone streets, taking in the sights and sounds of the bustling city. The woman's words echoed in my mind, and I couldn't shake the feeling that I had stumbled upon something much bigger than I initially thought. I walked for a few blocks, trying to clear my head, when I heard the sound of horse hooves behind me. I turned to see a black carriage racing towards me, the woman's face pressed against the window, her eyes locked onto mine. I quickened my pace, but the carriage was gaining on me fast. I could feel my heart pounding in my chest as I dodged pedestrians and leapt over puddles, desperate to lose the carriage in the crowded streets. But it was no use, the carriage was closing in, and I knew I had to think fast if I wanted to get away. I spotted a narrow alleyway to my left and made a beeline for it, hoping to lose the carriage in the narrow passage. I squeezed through the alley, my heart racing with anticipation, and emerged on the other side, gasping for breath. I looked back to see the carriage screeching to a halt at the entrance to the alley, the woman's face twisted in a mixture of anger and frustration. I took a deep breath and continued on my way, wondering what I had just gotten myself into.

en_first_half: “My cabby drove fast. I don’t think I ever drove faster, but the others were there before us. The cab and the landau with their steaming horses were in front of the door when I arrived. I paid the man and hurried into the church. There was not a soul there save the two whom I had followed and a surpliced
en_second_half: clergyman, who seemed to be expostulating with them. They were all three standing in a knot in front of the altar. I lounged up the side aisle like any other idler who has dropped into a church. Suddenly, to my surprise, the three at the altar faced round to me, and Godfrey Norton came running as hard as he could towards me.
en_results_raw: The clergyman, who was standing at the altar, looked up and caught my eye. I felt a shiver run down my spine as our gazes met, but I quickly looked away, trying to appear nonchalant. The two individuals, a man and a woman, were standing near the front pew, their faces obscured by the shadows. They seemed to be waiting for someone, or perhaps something. The air inside the church was heavy with anticipation, and I could feel the weight of their expectation. I took a deep breath and made my way down the aisle, trying to blend in with the other guests. But as I approached the pew where the couple was seated, I noticed something peculiar - a small, intricately carved box on the floor beside them, adorned with strange symbols and markings that seemed to shimmer in the dim light. I felt a sudden jolt of curiosity and wondered what it could be, and why it was there.

en_first_half: Holmes had sat up upon the couch, and I saw him motion like a man who is in need of air. A maid rushed across and threw open the window. At the same instant I saw him raise his hand and at the signal I tossed my rocket into the room with a cry of “Fire!” The word was no sooner out of my mouth than the whole crowd of spectators, well dressed and ill—gentlemen, ostlers, and servant maids—joined in a general shriek of “Fire!” Thick clouds of smoke curled through the room
en_second_half: and out at the open window. I caught a glimpse of rushing figures, and a moment later the voice of Holmes from within assuring them that it was a false alarm. Slipping through the shouting crowd I made my way to the corner of the street, and in ten minutes was rejoiced to find my friend’s arm in mine, and to get away from the scene of uproar. He walked swiftly and in silence for some few minutes until we had turned down one of the quiet streets which lead towards the Edgeware Road.
en_results_raw: The flames, which had been smoldering in the corner, suddenly burst into a fierce blaze, and the room was filled with a warm, golden light. The crowd, now thoroughly alarmed, surged forward in a panic, pushing and shoving each other in their haste to escape. I stood frozen in the doorway, my eyes fixed on Holmes, who was still sitting on the couch, his eyes fixed intently on the fire. The maid, who had thrown open the window, was now frantically trying to close it, but it was too late. The flames were spreading rapidly, and the room was filling with smoke. I could hear the sound of breaking glass and the creaking of the old wooden floorboards as the fire consumed everything in its path. The crowd, now a chaotic mass of people, was pouring out into the street, screaming and shouting. I took a step forward, my heart racing with fear, and called out to Holmes, but he didn't seem to hear me. He was still sitting on the couch, his eyes fixed on the fire, a look of intense concentration on his face. I took another step forward, my eyes scanning the room for any sign of danger, and that's when I saw it - a small, leather-bound book lying on the floor, partially hidden by the smoke. It was open to a page with a single sentence highlighted in red ink: "The game's afoot." I felt a shiver run down my spine as I realized that this was no ordinary fire. It was a signal, a message from Holmes, and I knew that we were in for a wild and unpredictable ride.

es_first_half: Holmes se había sentado en el sofá y le vi moverse como un hombre que necesita respirar. Una criada se apresuró a abrir la ventana. En el mismo instante le vi levantar la mano y a la señal lancé mi cohete a la habitación con un grito de "¡Fuego!". La palabra no había salido de mi boca cuando toda la multitud de espectadores, tanto los bien vestidos como los mal vestidos, caballeros, posaderos y sirvientas, se unieron en un grito general de "¡Fuego!". Gruesas nubes de humo se extendieron por la habitación
es_second_half: y salieron por la ventana abierta. Alcancé a ver unas figuras que se apresuraban, y un momento después la voz de Holmes desde el interior asegurando que era una falsa alarma. Deslizándome entre la multitud que gritaba, me dirigí a la esquina de la calle, y en diez minutos me alegré de encontrar el brazo de mi amigo entre los míos, y de alejarme de la escena del alboroto. Caminó con rapidez y en silencio durante algunos minutos hasta que doblamos por una de las tranquilas calles que conducen a Edgeware Road.
es_results_raw: por la habitación, y la luz del sol se vio reducida a un débil resplandor. La habitación se llenó de un calor intenso y el humo comenzó a cubrir todo, dificultando la visibilidad. Holmes, sin perder la calma, se levantó del sofá y se dirigió hacia la puerta, gritando "¡Salgamos de aquí!" a los que estaban a su alrededor. La criada, que había estado paralizada con la mano en la manija de la ventana, se recuperó y se unió a él, abriendo la puerta y permitiendo que la multitud escapara. Pero justo cuando todos estaban a punto de salir, Holmes se detuvo y se volvió hacia mí, sus ojos brillando con una idea. "¡Esperen!", exclamó, y se dirigió hacia la chimenea, donde comenzó a buscar algo entre las cenizas. La multitud se detuvo, confundida, mientras Holmes buscaba desesperadamente algo en la oscuridad. Finalmente, sacó una pequeña caja de metal y la abrió, revelando un pequeño reloj de bolsillo. "¡Es el reloj de la víctima!", exclamó, y su rostro se iluminó con una sonrisa de triunfo. La multitud se acercó, intrigada, y Holmes comenzó a explicar su teoría sobre el misterioso caso. Pero justo en ese momento, escuchamos un ruido detrás de nosotros, y nos volvimos a ver a un hombre que se acercaba hacia nosotros, su rostro cubierto con una capucha. "¿Quién es ese?", pregunté a Holmes, pero él simplemente me miró y dijo "Es el hombre que ha estado detrás de todo esto desde el principio". La multitud se quedó en silencio, expectante, mientras el hombre se acercaba hacia nosotros, su presencia llenando la habitación con una sensación de miedo y suspense.

en_results_raw: the art of the detective lies in observing the small details that others often overlook, and in piecing together seemingly unrelated facts to form a coherent picture. It was with this in mind that I had been studying the case of Miss Sutherland, and I must say that I was intrigued by the peculiar circumstances surrounding her disappearance. The fact that she had been seen entering the house of a wealthy businessman on the night of her disappearance, and the subsequent discovery of a cryptic letter on her dresser, only added to the mystery. I had been pondering these facts for hours, trying to make sense of them, when suddenly, a knock at the door interrupted my thoughts. It was Inspector Lestrade, looking more serious than I had ever seen him before. "Holmes," he said, "I have some news that I think you will find interesting. We have received a tip that a suspicious character was seen lurking around the area where Miss Sutherland was last seen. We have reason to believe that this individual may be connected to a larger scheme, one that involves several other missing persons in the city." I listened intently as Lestrade continued to explain the details of the case, my mind racing with possibilities and theories. The game, as they say, was afoot.

Sin embargo, la Liga también tenía un lado oscuro, y muchos rumores circulaban sobre sus métodos poco ortodoxos para obtener información y sus experimentos peligrosos con la fuerza paranormal. A pesar de esto, muchos miembros de la Liga creían que el fin justificaba los medios, y estaban dispuestos a arriesgar su propia seguridad para descubrir los secretos del más allá. La Liga era un lugar donde la curiosidad y la ambición se encontraban con la oscuridad y la locura, y donde la línea entre la realidad y la fantasía se difuminaba. Algunos decían que la Liga era una trampa mortal, un lugar donde la gente se perdía para siempre en el laberinto de sus propias obsesiones. Otros afirmaban que era un lugar de libertad, donde la gente podía ser ella misma sin miedo a la opinión de los demás. Pero lo que era cierto era que la Liga era un lugar de misterio y peligro, un lugar donde la verdad era un lujo que se podía permitirse muy pocas veces. La pregunta era, ¿qué me esperaba a mí cuando me uniera a la Liga? ¿Sería una aventura emocionante o una trampa mortal? Solo el tiempo lo diría.

La clave para resolver cualquier caso es analizar los detalles, no importa cuán insignificantes parezcan, y buscar patrones y conexiones que puedan llevar a la verdad. La mente de un detective debe ser como un microscopio, capaz de ampliar detalles y encontrar lo que otros pasan por alto.

Holmes's breathing was the only sound I could hear, steady and calm, as if he was savoring the moment. I strained my ears to pick up any other noise, but the darkness was absolute, a living, breathing entity that wrapped itself around me like a shroud. The seconds ticked by at a glacial pace, each one an eternity as I waited for something, anything, to happen. And then, without warning, Holmes spoke, his voice low and even, "Do you hear that?" he whispered, his words barely audible over the sound of my own ragged breathing.

El plan era simple: crear un escenario que hiciera que el señor Wilson creyera que había encontrado la solución a su problema, pero en realidad, sería una trampa. La Liga había contratado a un actor para que se disfrazara de un experto en la materia y le diera a Wilson una serie de consejos que parecían sensatos, pero en realidad, lo llevarían a un callejón sin salida. La Liga estaba ansiosa por ver cómo reaccionaría Wilson a la noticia, y estaba dispuesta a hacer lo que fuera necesario para mantener su secreto a salvo. Mientras tanto, el señor Wilson seguía buscando la solución a su problema, sin sospechar que estaba a punto de caer en una trampa peligrosa.

Anh cố gắng kết nối các mảnh ghép lại với nhau, nhưng vẫn chưa thể tìm ra được câu trả lời. "Cần phải suy nghĩ kỹ hơn", anh nói với bản thân, "cần phải tìm ra được điểm bắt đầu". Anh tiếp tục ngồi im lặng, suy nghĩ về vụ án, và cố gắng tìm ra được giải pháp. Sau một thời gian, anh bắt đầu thấy một số ý tưởng bắt đầu hình thành trong đầu mình, và anh bắt đầu viết ra những ghi chú trên một tờ giấy. "Có thể đây là chìa khóa để giải quyết vụ án", anh nói với bản thân, "cần phải kiểm tra lại tất cả các chi tiết".

"Estoy tratando de conectar los puntos, Watson", dijo finalmente, "pero no puedo encontrar la conexión que falta". Watson se sentó en la silla frente a él, esperando a que su amigo continuara. Holmes se encogió de hombros, como si estuviera tratando de recordar algo que se le había escapado. La habitación se quedó en silencio durante un momento, mientras Holmes y Watson se sumergían en sus pensamientos, tratando de encontrar la clave para resolver el misterio. Finalmente, Holmes se levantó de su silla, como si hubiera tenido una idea. "Voy a investigar un poco más", dijo, dirigiéndose hacia la puerta. Watson asintió con la cabeza, sabiendo que su amigo estaba en el rastro de algo importante. "Voy contigo", dijo, siguiendo a Holmes hacia la puerta. Juntos, se dirigieron hacia la calle Baker, listos para enfrentar lo que la investigación les deparara. en_first_half: “The man married a woman very much older than himself for her money,” said he, “and he enjoyed the use of the money of the daughter as long as she lived with them. It was a considerable sum, for people in their position, and the loss of it would have made a serious difference. It was worth an effort to preserve it. The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course
en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”
en_results_raw: The stepfather, being a shrewd and calculating man, decided to take drastic measures to prevent the loss of his stepdaughter's income. He began by making her life at home as unbearable as possible, hoping that she would be driven to seek a solution elsewhere. He criticized her constantly, finding fault in everything she did, from the way she dressed to the way she cooked. He made her feel like a burden, a mere means to an end, and not a member of the family. He also started to limit her freedom, restricting her from going out and socializing with friends, under the guise of protecting her from the dangers of the world. He even went so far as to suggest that she was not suited for marriage, that she was too old and too set in her ways, and that no man would ever be interested in her. The stepdaughter, being a kind and gentle soul, was taken aback by her stepfather's behavior, but she tried to brush it off, thinking that he was just being his usual grumpy self. However, as the days turned into weeks, and the weeks turned into months, she began to realize that her stepfather's behavior was not just a phase, but a deliberate attempt to control her life. She started to feel trapped, like a bird in a gilded cage, and she knew that she had to find a way to escape. She began to make plans, quietly and secretly, to secure her own future, and to ensure that she would not be at the mercy of her stepfather's whims. She knew it wouldn't be easy, but she was determined to take control of her life, and to make her own decisions. Little did she know, however, that her stepfather had other plans, plans that would change the course of her life forever.

es_first_half: "El hombre se casó con una mujer mucho mayor que él por su dinero -dijo-, y disfrutó del dinero de la hija mientras ella vivió con ellos. Era una suma considerable, para gente de su posición, y su pérdida habría supuesto una gran diferencia. Merecía la pena hacer un esfuerzo para conservarlo. La hija era de buena disposición, afable, pero cariñosa y afectuosa a su manera, de modo que era evidente que con sus buenas ventajas personales y sus escasos ingresos, no se le permitiría permanecer soltera por mucho tiempo. Ahora bien, su matrimonio significaría, por supuesto, la pérdida de cien dólares al año, así que ¿qué hace su padrastro para evitarlo? Toma la medida obvia de mantenerla en casa y prohibirle
es_second_half: que busque la compañía de personas de su edad. Pero pronto se dio cuenta de que eso no sería suficiente para siempre. Ella se inquieta, insiste en sus derechos y finalmente anuncia su intención de ir a un baile. ¿Qué hace entonces su inteligente padrastro? Concibe una idea más digna de su cabeza que de su corazón. Con la connivencia y la ayuda de su esposa se disfrazó, cubrió esos ojos agudos con gafas tintadas, enmascaró la cara con un bigote y un par de bigotes tupidos, hundió esa voz clara en un susurro insinuante, y doblemente protegido a causa de la corta vista de la chica, se presenta como el señor Hosmer Angel, y aleja a otros amantes al enamorarla él mismo."

Sin embargo, la situación no tarda en volverse complicada, ya que la hija comienza a notar que su padrastro está siendo cada vez más estricto y controlador, y que su madre parece estar cada vez más influenciada por él. La hija se siente atrapada entre su amor por su madre y su deseo de independencia, y comienza a cuestionar si su situación es realmente tan buena como parece. Mientras tanto, el padrastro sigue adelante con su plan, convencido de que está haciendo lo mejor para la familia, pero sin darse cuenta de que su comportamiento está causando más daño que beneficio. La tensión en la casa comienza a aumentar, y la hija se pregunta qué pasará si su madre se da cuenta de la verdad. ¿Se dará cuenta de que su padrastro está tratando de controlarla, o seguirá creyendo que está haciendo lo mejor por ella? La situación se vuelve cada vez más incómoda, y la hija se siente atrapada en un dilema difícil de resolver.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.
en_results_raw: The trees and hedges whizzed by in a green and brown blur, and I felt a bit queasy from the constant jolting of the carriage. I turned my attention back to Colonel Stark, who was still gazing at me with an unnerving intensity. His eyes seemed to bore into my very soul, and I felt a shiver run down my spine. I tried to break the silence by speaking, but my voice caught in my throat. The only sound was the creaking of the carriage and the rhythmic thud of the horses' hooves on the rough road. I glanced at the Colonel again, and this time he looked away, his eyes returning to the road ahead. The silence between us grew thicker, and I began to feel a sense of unease. I wondered what he wanted from me, and why he was being so mysterious. The carriage suddenly lurched to one side, and I grabbed hold of the door to steady myself. Colonel Stark's eyes snapped back to mine, and for a moment, I thought I saw a flicker of something like amusement in their depths. But it was quickly replaced by his usual serious expression. I let out a sigh of relief as the carriage righted itself, and we continued on our journey. The trees and hedges seemed to be getting denser, and I caught glimpses of a large stone wall in the distance. I wondered if we were approaching a house or a estate of some sort. The Colonel's silence was starting to get on my nerves, and I found myself glancing at him more and more frequently. He seemed to be lost in thought, his eyes fixed on some point in the distance. I tried to make out what he was looking at, but it was too far away. The carriage slowed to a stop, and I felt a jolt of surprise. We had arrived at our destination, but I had no idea where we were or what to expect. The Colonel turned to me, his eyes locked on mine, and I felt a shiver run down my spine once again. "We're here," he said, his voice low and gravelly. I nodded, trying to play it cool, but my heart was racing with anticipation. What lay ahead, I had no idea, but I was about to find out.

Ông ta ngồi bên cạnh tôi và suốt chặng đường chẳng hề mở miệng, cứ mỗi lần liếc nhìn về phía ông ta, tôi lại thấy ông ta đang nhìn tôi với ánh mắt hết sức căng thẳng. Tôi cố gắng nhìn ra ngoài cửa sổ để xem mình đang đi đến đâu nhưng kính cửa là loại thủy tinh đã mài mờ nên tôi chẳng phân biệt được gì ngoại trừ một vài vệt sáng lờ mờ thỉnh thoảng băng ngang qua. es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."
es_results_raw: en cuando nos detuvimos en una pequeña estación de servicio. El conductor se apeó y se dirigió hacia la cabina, mientras que yo me quedé sentado en el asiento trasero, intentando adivinar dónde estábamos. El coronel Stark se levantó y se acercó a mí, con una mirada seria en el rostro. "¿Estás bien?", me preguntó, y su voz sonó más suave de lo que esperaba. Me sorprendió su preocupación, pero no pude evitar sentirme un poco incómodo. "Sí, estoy bien", respondí, intentando sonar lo más natural posible. El coronel asintió y se sentó a mi lado, mirando hacia adelante. "¿Qué te parece si salimos a estirar las piernas?", sugirió, y se levantó del asiento. Me levanté también, y salimos de la estación de servicio, dejando atrás el ruido y la confusión del vehículo. El aire fresco me golpeó en la cara, y me sentí un poco más aliviado. Mientras caminábamos hacia el borde de la carretera, el coronel Stark se detuvo y se volvió hacia mí. "¿Sabes por qué estamos aquí?", me preguntó, y su mirada era intensa. Me sentí un poco nervioso, pero intenté mantener la calma. "No", respondí, y esperé a que me explicara. El coronel asintió, y comenzó a hablar en voz baja, pero con una determinación en su voz. "Estamos aquí para hablar con alguien", dijo. "Alguien que puede ayudarnos a encontrar lo que estamos buscando". Me miró a los ojos, y su mirada me hizo sentir un escalofrío. "¿Qué es lo que estamos buscando?", pregunté, intentando mantener la calma. El coronel Stark se encogió de hombros. "No puedo decirte eso todavía", respondió. "Pero te prometo que es importante". Me sentí un poco confundido, pero intenté no hacer preguntas. "¿Quién es la persona que vamos a ver?", pregunté en su lugar. El coronel asintió. "Se llama el señor Jenkins", dijo. "Es un hombre que conoce mucho sobre... ciertas cosas". Me miró a los ojos, y su mirada me hizo sentir que estaba diciendo algo más, algo que no quería que yo supiera. Me sentí un poco incómodo, pero intenté no hacer preguntas. "¿Qué tipo de cosas?", pregunté, intentando mantener la calma. El coronel Stark se encogió de hombros. "No puedo decirte eso todavía", respondió. "Pero te prometo que es importante". Me sentí un poco frustrado, pero intenté no hacer preguntas. "¿Cuándo llegaremos?", pregunté en su lugar. El coronel asintió. "Pronto", dijo. "Estamos cerca". Me sentí un poco aliviado, pero también un poco inquieto. ¿Qué estaba pasando? ¿Qué era lo que estábamos buscando? ¿Y quién era el señor Jenkins? Me sentí un poco perdido, pero intenté mantener la calma. El coronel Stark se volvió hacia mí, y su mirada me hizo sentir que estaba diciendo algo más, algo que no quería que yo supiera. "No podemos fallar", dijo. "Tenemos que encontrarlo". Me sentí un poco asustado, pero intenté no hacer preguntas. ¿Qué estaba pasando? ¿Qué era lo que estaba en juego? El coronel Stark se encogió de hombros. "No podemos fallar", dijo.
tr_first_half: "Derken yola çıktıktan sonra en az bir saat boyunca gittik. Albay Lysander Stark bana yalnızca yedi mil demişti ama gittiğimiz hızı ve süreyi düşündüğümde en az on iki mil olduğuna bahse girerim. Bütün yol boyunca yanımda sessizce oturdu. Ara sıra ona doğru göz ucuyla baktığımda, beni büyük bir dikkatle incelediğini fark ettim. Oraların yolları bozuktu galiba, çünkü feci bir şekilde sallanıp duruyorduk. Dışarı bakıp nerede olduğumu bilmek istediysem de pencereler buzlu camla kaplanmış olduğu için görebildiğim tek şey, yanından ara sıra geçtiğimiz ışıkların
tr_second_half: puslu parlaklığıydı. Arada bir yolculuğun monoton havasını dağıtmak için bir iki laf etsem albay, tek kelimelik cevaplarla yetiniyor, böylece sohbet daha başlamadan bitiyordu. Neyse, sonunda bozuk yoldan kumlu düzgün bir yola çıktık. Az sonra fayton durdu. Albay Lysander Stark hemen dışarı fırladı. Arkasından indiğimde beni çabucak, açık duran bir kapıdan içeri itti. Arabadan inmiş ve hemen bir hole girmiştik, böylece evin önüne ait en ufak birşey dahi görememiştim. Kapıdan içeriye adım atar atmaz kapı arkamdan hızla kapandı, uzaklaşan arabanın belli belirsiz tekerlek tıngırtılarını duydum.
tr_results_raw: yanlış bir şekilde yansıdığı karlar ve ağaçların karla kaplı dallarıydı. Sanki bir rüya gibi gidiyorduk, ama ben uyanık ve gerçeklikten uzak bir halim vardı. Albay Stark'ın bana bakışlarındaki o dikkatli ifade, beni huzursuz ediyordu. Ne düşündüğünü bilmiyordum, ama o kadar uzun süredir yanındayken, bir şeyler hissediyordum. Belki de sadece imgelemimdi, belki de gerçekti, ama o an için önemli değildi. Önemli olan, nereye gidiyorduk ve neden gidiyorduk. Yolun kenarında duran ağaçlar, birer birer geçip gidiyorduk. Karlı bir gün, karın altında kaybolan bir yol, ve ben bir yabancı gibi, bilinmeyen bir yere doğru gidiyordum. Albay Stark'ın sesini duyamıyordum, ama onun soluklarını duyabiliyordum. Hafif, düzenli, ve bir o kadar da huzursuz edici. Bir an için duraklayıp, ona doğru dönüp bakmak istedim, ama o bana bakıyordu. O an, bir an için, gözlerimizin kesişti. Ve ben, bir an için, onun düşüncelerini okudum. Belki de sadece bir imgeleme, belki de gerçek, ama o an için, biliyordum. Biliyordum ki, nereye gidiyorduk, ve neden gidiyorduk. Ve biliyordum ki, o da biliyordu.

en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.
en_results_raw: The light danced across her features, illuminating her high cheekbones and full lips. Her eyes, a deep shade of brown, sparkled with a mixture of curiosity and concern as she took in the sight of the colonel and me standing in the dimly lit hallway. She seemed to be trying to place us, her gaze darting back and forth between us as if searching for some familiar connection. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled forward, his eyes fixed on the lamp in her hand. "Ah, thank goodness you're here," he exclaimed, his voice a little louder than necessary. "I seem to have lost my way in this confounded house." The woman's expression softened, and she took a step closer, her eyes never leaving the colonel's face. "I'm afraid you must be the guests I've been expecting," she said, her voice low and melodious. "I'm Mrs. Jenkins, the owner of this house. Please, come in, and let me show you to your rooms." She gestured towards the door behind her, and the colonel, still fumbling with his matches, nodded gratefully and followed her into the room. I trailed behind, my eyes fixed on the woman's back as she led us deeper into the house. The hallway seemed to stretch on forever, lined with cobweb-covered portraits and dusty vases that seemed to be watching us as we passed. I couldn't shake the feeling that we were being led further and further into a trap, but I couldn't quite put my finger on why. As we turned a corner, the woman stopped in front of a large wooden door and pushed it open with a creak. "Your room is just through here," she said, her voice a little too cheerful. I hesitated, feeling a shiver run down my spine as I stepped inside. The room was small and cozy, with a large four-poster bed in the center of the room. But it was the window that caught my attention - it was open, and a faint breeze rustled the curtains, carrying with it the scent of blooming flowers and something else, something sweet and decaying. I felt a shiver run down my spine as I realized that we were not alone in the house, and that something was watching us from the shadows.
vi_first_half: Trong nhà tối đen như mực, ông đại tá lần mò tìm diêm và nói thì thầm gì đó. Thình lình một cánh cửa mở ra ở cuối lối đi và một dải ánh sáng dài màu vàng tỏa về phía chúng tôi. Quầng sáng lớn dần lên và một người phụ nữ xuất hiện, giơ một ngọn đèn cao quá đầu. Bà ta ngấng mặt lên và chăm chú nhìn chúng tôi. Tôi có thể thấy rõ là bà ta khá đẹp và qua vẻ bóng mượt của bộ y phục sẫm
vi_second_half: màu được ánh sáng chiếu rọi, tôi biết đó là một loại vải đắt tiền. Bà ta nói vài lời bằng tiếng nước ngoài với ngữ điệu giống như một câu hỏi và khi người đi cùng tôi xẵng giọng trả lời thì bà ta giật mình khiến cho ngọn đèn suýt chút nữa tuột khỏi tay. Đại tá Stark bước đến gần bà ta, thì thào vào tai rồi đẩy bà ta trở lại căn phòng mà bà ta vừa bước ra, sau đó ông ta cầm đèn bước về phía tôi.
vi_results_raw: nhạt màu, tôi đoán bà ta là một người phụ nữ sang trọng và có địa vị cao. Bà ta bước vào trong nhà và ánh sáng từ đèn của bà ta làm cho không gian tối tăm trở nên ấm áp hơn. Tôi có thể thấy rõ được sự tự tin và quyền lực tỏa ra từ người phụ nữ này. Bà ta bước đến gần chúng tôi và nói một cách nhẹ nhàng, "Chào mừng các vị khách quý, tôi là chủ nhà. Tôi đã chờ đợi các vị từ lâu. Tôi tên là Bà Lão, và tôi sẽ là người hướng dẫn cho các vị trong suốt chuyến thăm này. Hãy theo tôi đi, chúng ta sẽ bắt đầu hành trình khám phá những bí mật của ngôi nhà này." Bà Lão bước đi trước, và chúng tôi theo sau, cảm thấy một chút tò mò và sợ hãi. Chúng tôi không biết mình đang bước vào thế giới nào, nhưng chúng tôi biết rằng chúng tôi đã bắt đầu một hành trình đầy thú vị. Khi chúng tôi bước vào sâu hơn trong nhà, tôi có thể thấy được những bức tường được trang trí bằng những tác phẩm nghệ thuật độc đáo và những đồ vật cổ kính. Những thứ này làm cho không gian trở nên giàu có và sang trọng hơn. Tôi có thể cảm nhận được sự giàu có và quyền lực của Bà Lão từ những thứ này. Chúng tôi tiếp tục đi sâu hơn, và tôi có thể thấy được một cánh cửa lớn dẫn đến một phòng khác. Bà Lão bước vào và nói, "Đây là phòng bí mật của tôi. Đây là nơi tôi giữ những bí mật và những điều quan trọng nhất của mình." Tôi cảm thấy một chút tò mò và sợ hãi khi nhìn vào phòng này. Tôi không biết mình sẽ thấy gì, nhưng tôi biết rằng tôi sẽ phải đối mặt với những điều không thể tưởng tượng được. Chúng tôi bước vào phòng và tôi có thể thấy được những thứ kỳ lạ và bí ẩn. Tôi không thể tin được những gì tôi đang thấy, nhưng tôi biết rằng tôi đã bước vào một thế giới hoàn toàn mới. Tôi cảm thấy như mình đang ở trong một giấc mơ, nhưng tôi biết rằng tôi đang ở trong một thế giới thực. Tôi không biết mình sẽ phải đối mặt với những gì, nhưng tôi biết rằng tôi sẽ phải đối mặt với những điều không thể tưởng tượng được. Tôi cảm thấy một chút sợ hãi, nhưng tôi cũng cảm thấy một chút tò mò và hứng thú. Tôi biết rằng tôi sẽ phải đối mặt với những điều mới mẻ và thú vị, và tôi sẵn sàng để khám phá những bí mật của ngôi nhà này.
es_first_half: "Estaba muy oscuro dentro de la casa, y el coronel buscaba a tientas cerillas y murmuraba en voz baja. De repente se abrió una puerta en el otro extremo del pasillo y una larga barra de luz dorada salió disparada en nuestra dirección. Se ensanchó y apareció una mujer con una lámpara en la mano, que sostenía por encima de la cabeza, adelantando la cara y mirándonos. Pude ver que era guapa, y por el brillo con que la luz iluminaba
es_second_half: su vestido oscuro supe que era de un material rico. Pronunció algunas palabras en una lengua extranjera, en un tono como si estuviera haciendo una pregunta, y cuando mi compañero respondió con un monosílabo ronco, se sobresaltó tanto que la lámpara casi se le cayó de la mano. El coronel Stark se acercó a ella, le susurró algo al oído y luego, empujándola hacia la habitación de la que había salido, volvió a caminar hacia mí con la lámpara en la mano."
es_results_raw: su rostro, pude ver que tenía ojos verdes brillantes y una sonrisa que parecía iluminar la oscuridad. La mujer se acercó a nosotros con la lámpara en alto, y el coronel se detuvo en seco, mirándola con una mezcla de sorpresa y curiosidad. La mujer se detuvo frente a nosotros, y su mirada se posó en el coronel, como si estuviera evaluándolo. Luego, su mirada se desplazó hacia mí, y me sentí un escalofrío recorrer mi espalda. Me pareció que la mujer me estaba viendo a través de mí, como si pudiera ver algo que yo mismo no sabía que estaba allí. El coronel se aclaró la garganta y habló en voz baja, "¿Puedo ayudarte, señora?" La mujer asintió con la cabeza y se acercó un poco más, su voz suave y melodiosa, "Sí, necesito hablar con usted, coronel. Tengo algo importante que decirle". Me pareció que la mujer estaba nerviosa, pero intentaba mantener la calma. El coronel asintió con la cabeza y se hizo a un lado, permitiendo que la mujer pasara. Ella se detuvo en el umbral de la puerta y se volvió hacia mí, su mirada intensa, como si estuviera esperando que yo hiciera algo. Me sentí incómodo bajo su mirada, pero no sabía qué hacer. El coronel se acercó a la mujer y habló en voz baja, "¿Qué es lo que necesita decirme, señora?" La mujer se aclaró la garganta y comenzó a hablar, su voz llena de determinación, "Necesito hablar con usted sobre el asunto de la casa. He descubierto algo que podría cambiar todo". El coronel se inclinó hacia adelante, su interés pico, y la mujer continuó hablando, su voz llena de emoción, "He descubierto que la casa está llena de secretos, secretos que podrían poner en peligro a todos". Me pareció que la mujer estaba hablando en serio, y el coronel parecía estar tomando en serio sus palabras. en_first_half: “It is fortunate, for you will perhaps be able to post me up. I read nothing except the criminal news and the agony column.
en_second_half: The latter is always instructive. But if you have followed recent events so closely you must have read about Lord St. Simon and his wedding?”
en_results_raw: The only reason I bother with the newspaper at all is that it's the one place where I can find some semblance of connection to the outside world, a world that seems to be moving forward while I'm stuck in this dingy, cramped flat, surrounded by nothing but dust and the faint scent of decay. I've lost count of the days, weeks, months – time has no meaning when you're trapped in a never-ending cycle of loneliness and desperation. The agony column is my only solace, a reminder that I'm not the only one struggling, that there are others out there who are just as lost and broken as I am. And the criminal news, well, that's just a reminder of the dangers that lurk in every shadow, a constant reminder that I'm not safe, that I'm just one misstep away from disaster. But still, I read on, hoping against hope that somehow, someway, I'll find a way out of this nightmare and back into the light.
vi_first_half: “May nhỉ, vì như thế anh có thể cập nhật tin tức cho tôi. Tôi chẳng xem mục gì khác ngoài các tin tức về tội phạm và mục tin nhắn. Chuyên mục ấy luôn cung
vi_second_half: cấp cho ta nhiều tư liệu. Nhưng nếu anh theo dõi sát sao các sự kiện gần đây, hẳn là anh đã đọc tin về huân tước St. Simon và đám cưới của ông ta rồi chứ?”
vi_results_raw: được cập nhật liên tục và đầy đủ, giúp tôi nắm bắt được tình hình tội phạm tại thành phố một cách nhanh chóng và chính xác. Tôi đặc biệt quan tâm đến các tin tức về tội phạm nghiêm trọng như trộm cắp, giết người và buôn bán ma túy. Những thông tin này giúp tôi hiểu rõ hơn về tình hình an ninh tại thành phố và có thể đề phòng những nguy cơ tiềm ẩn. Ngoài ra, mục tin nhắn cũng rất hữu ích khi giúp tôi kết nối với các thành viên trong cộng đồng và chia sẻ thông tin, kinh nghiệm về an ninh và phòng chống tội phạm. Tôi hy vọng rằng chuyên mục này sẽ tiếp tục được cập nhật thường xuyên và cung cấp thông tin chính xác, giúp tôi và cộng đồng trở nên an toàn hơn.”
es_first_half: "Es una suerte, ya que tal vez pueda usted ponerme al día. No leo nada más que las noticias criminales y la columna de opinión.
es_second_half: Esta última es siempre instructiva. Pero si ha seguido tan de cerca los acontecimientos recientes, debe haber leído lo de Lord St. Simon y su boda..."
es_results_raw: Me encanta leer sobre política y economía, pero últimamente no he tenido tiempo para nada más. Mi trabajo ha sido muy exigente y no he podido seguir mis intereses como antes. ¿Qué ha estado pasando en el mundo de las noticias? ¿Qué ha sido lo más destacado últimamente? ¿Han habido algún cambio importante en la política local o nacional? Me gustaría saber qué ha estado sucediendo mientras yo no estaba al tanto.

en_first_half: “That is well. The letter which I hold in my hand is from Lord St. Simon. I will read it to you,
en_second_half: and in return you must turn over these papers and let me have whatever bears upon the matter. This is what he says:
en_results_raw: The contents of which I must warn you may be somewhat distressing, but I believe it is essential to share with you the news that has been conveyed to me. As I unfold the parchment, I notice that the seal is still intact, indicating that the letter has not been tampered with. I take a deep breath and begin to read aloud, my voice steady and clear, 'My dear Lady Emily, I write to you with a heavy heart, bearing news that I fear will bring you great sorrow. It is with a deep sense of regret that I must inform you of the passing of your brother, Lord Thomas. He met his untimely demise in a tragic accident while on a hunting expedition in the countryside. I know that this news will come as a devastating blow to you and your family, and I can only offer my sincerest condolences during this difficult time.' I pause, allowing the weight of the words to sink in, before continuing to read on, my eyes scanning the page for any further details.
vi_first_half: “Thế thì tốt. Lá thư tôi đang cầm đây là do huân tước St. Simon gửi đến. Tôi sẽ đọc cho anh nghe và đổi lại,
vi_second_half: anh phải xem lại chồng báo đó và kể cho tôi biết những gì có liên quan đến vấn đề này. Đây, ông ta viết thế này:
vi_results_raw: nhưng trước tiên, tôi muốn biết anh có muốn nghe trước khi tôi đọc hay không. Tôi nhớ lại những ngày tháng ở Versailles, khi tôi còn là một thiếu niên, và huân tước St. Simon đã trở thành người bạn thân thiết của tôi. Chúng ta đã cùng nhau khám phá những bí mật của cung điện, và anh đã chia sẻ với tôi những câu chuyện về lịch sử của hoàng gia. Tôi vẫn nhớ rõ những điều đó như ngày hôm qua. Tôi sẽ bắt đầu đọc lá thư này, và tôi hy vọng rằng nó sẽ mang lại cho anh những thông tin quý giá về quá khứ của chúng ta.

La explicación C, por otro lado, sugiere que los agujeros negros son en realidad puertas de entrada a dimensiones paralelas, lo que plantea preguntas sobre la naturaleza de la realidad y la existencia de la materia y la energía en estos entornos. La explicación D, aunque similar a la C, sugiere que los agujeros negros son más bien puertas de salida de estas dimensiones, lo que plantea preguntas sobre la posibilidad de viajar a través de ellos y regresar a nuestro universo. La explicación E propone que los agujeros negros son en realidad regiones de espacio-tiempo donde la gravedad es tan fuerte que distorsiona la luz y la materia, lo que hace que parezcan "negros" debido a la falta de radiación emitida. La explicación F sugiere que los agujeros negros son en realidad regiones de espacio-tiempo donde la materia y la energía se han colapsado en un punto infinitamente denso, lo que hace que la gravedad sea tan fuerte que nada, ni siquiera la luz, puede escapar. La explicación G, por último, propone que los agujeros negros son en realidad regiones de espacio-tiempo donde la ley de la conservación de la energía no se aplica, lo que permite que la materia y la energía se acumulen en un punto sin que se produzca una explosión de radiación. Cada una de estas explicaciones plantea preguntas y desafíos para los científicos que buscan entender la naturaleza de los agujeros negros y su papel en el universo.

The key was nowhere to be found, but I managed to pick the lock after a few minutes of fiddling with it. Inside, I discovered a series of old letters and diaries belonging to the former occupants of the house. They spoke of a dark family secret, one that had been hidden for generations. I couldn't help but feel that I was getting close to uncovering something sinister, but I had no idea what it was. As the days went by, I began to experience strange occurrences - doors creaking open on their own, objects moving by themselves, and an unshakeable feeling of being watched. I tried to convince myself that it was just the old house settling, but deep down, I knew it was something more. The more I delved into the mystery, the more I became convinced that the Copper Beeches held a dark and troubled history, one that I was determined to uncover. Little did I know, I was just scratching the surface of a much larger and more complex web of secrets and lies.

es_second_half: a una pequeña dependencia que se encuentra cerca de la puerta de la cocina. Cuando nos acercamos a él, oí el agudo traqueteo de una cadena y el sonido de un gran animal moviéndose.
es_results_raw: al jardín, donde me mostró un gran número de plantas exóticas y me explicó que era un gran apasionado de la botánica. Me pareció un hombre amable y educado, pero algo extraño, ya que parecía estar observándome con una intensidad que me hizo sentir incómodo. Al día siguiente, mientras estaba ayudando a la señora Rucastle en la cocina, me enteré de que el señor Rucastle había estado investigando sobre un tipo de planta venenosa que crecía en la zona, y que había estado estudiando sus propiedades y efectos. Me pregunté a mí mismo qué relación podía tener esto con la extraña actitud del señor Rucastle hacia mí, pero no pude encontrar ninguna respuesta. Mientras tanto, la señora Rucastle me había estado hablando sobre su hija, Laura, que había desaparecido hace varios años, y me había contado historias sobre su infancia y su personalidad. Me pareció que la señora Rucastle estaba muy unida a su hija, y que su desaparición la había afectado profundamente. Me pregunté si había alguna conexión entre la desaparición de Laura y la extraña actitud del señor Rucastle hacia mí, pero no pude encontrar ninguna respuesta. Al día siguiente, mientras estaba trabajando en el jardín, vi al señor Rucastle hablando con un hombre desconocido, y parecía que estaban discutiendo sobre algo en voz baja. Me pareció que el hombre desconocido era un tipo raro, con una mirada furtiva y un aire de misterio que me hizo sentir incómodo. Me pregunté qué podía estar pasando, y si había alguna conexión entre el hombre desconocido y la extraña actitud del señor Rucastle hacia mí.
